result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward L. Hanson Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Sentences of confinement in Taylor Co. Case No. 16CF2 and 16CF9.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim, Brandon M. Buehler, and be pre-approved by agent.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.   Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

records.addlTxt: of Plea & Sentencing held on October 20, 2016 - Lisa M. Weber, RMR, CRR

Defendant Edward L. Hanson in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tlusty places agreement on the record.  Victim rights complied. DE enters a plea of no contest to Ct. 1. Plea colloquy.  Factual basis exists.  Court finds plea given freely, voluntarily and intelligently; accepts plea; finds DE guilty.  Court dismisses, but read in Cts. 2 & 3. Court imposed a withheld sentence, placed DE on probation for 1 year, consecutive to Case Nos. 16CF2 and 16CF9 with conditions of: court costs, DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology to victim, preapproved by agent; restitution, to be determined within 30 days; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. ba
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 23, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Edward L. Hanson in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Defendant Edward L. Hanson in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court discussed with parties the status of the cases.  The attorneys requested that a pretrial conference be scheduled for July 15, 2016.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.
Status conference on June 2, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Status hearing on May 31, 2016 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Edward L. Hanson in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Hanson has Paul Goetz as his attorney for his other cases.  Court indicated that he will have to call the public defender's office to have him on this case.  Waive reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Court enters a plea of not guilty on defendant's behalf.  Court orders $1,000.00 signature bond; booking and no contact with D.J. D. - dob:  1-10-84; B.M.B. - dob:  2-7-87 and C.C.V. - dob: 8-2-82.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 11:00 am.  - rt
